Class Proj

    Justin Deoliveira, OpenGeo

    • Method Detail

      • crs

        public static org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs(int srid)
        Looks up a crs object base on its EPSG identifier.

        This method is equivalent to calling 

        crs("EPSG:" + srid)

        Returns:
        The matching crs object, or null if none found.

      • crs

        public static org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs(String s)
        Looks up a crs object base on its identifier.
        Returns:
        The matching crs object, or null if none found.

        Creates a crs object from projection parameter definition.
        Parameters:
        projdef - The projection / proj4 parameters.
        Returns:
        The crs object.

        Returns:

      • epsgCode

        public static Integer epsgCode(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Returns the EPSG identifier for a crs object.
        Returns:
        The epsg identifier, or null if the CRS has no epsg code.

      • bounds

        public static Bounds bounds(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs)
        Returns the valid bounds of the crs object.

        Warning: This method is as currently implemented is inaccurate.

        Returns:
        An approximate bounds of validity for the crs object, or null if it can not be determined.

      • reproject

        public static <T extends Geometry> T reproject(T g,
                               String from,
                               String to)
        Reprojects a geometry object between two coordinate reference systems.

        This method is convenience for: 

        
   reproject(g, crs(from), crs(to));

        Parameters:
        g - The geometry to reproject.
        from - The source crs, as defined by crs(String)
        to - The target crs, as defined by crs(String)
        Returns:
        The reprojected geometry.
        See Also:
        #crs(String)}, #reproject(Geometry, CoordinateReferenceSystem, CoordinateReferenceSystem)}

      • reproject

        public static <T extends Geometry> T reproject(T g,
                               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem from,
                               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem to)
        Reprojects a geometry object between two coordinate reference systems.

        In the event a transformation between the two crs objects can not be found this method throws IllegalArgumentException. In the event the two specified coordinate reference systems are equal this method is a no-op and returns the original geometry object.

        Parameters:
        g - The geometry to reproject.
        from - The source coordinate reference system.
        to - The target coordinate reference system.
        Returns:
        The reprojected geometry.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If no coordinate transform can be found.

      • transform

        public static <T extends Geometry> T transform(T g,
                               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateTransform tx)
        Transforms a geometry object using an explicit transformation.
        Parameters:
        g - The geometry.
        tx - The transform to to apply.
        Returns:
        The transformed geometry.

      • transform

        public static <T extends Geometry> T transform(T g,
                               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateTransform tx,
                               boolean inPlace)
        Transforms a geometry object using an explicit transformation with the option to do an in place transformation.

        When inPlace is set to true the geometry coordinates will be modified directly. When set to false a clone of the geometry is made and modified. Since cloning a geometry can be a very expensive operation doing an in place transform can be much more efficient but has the downside of modifying the geometry directly.

        Parameters:
        g - The geometry.
        tx - The transform to to apply.
        Returns:
        The transformed geometry.

      • reproject

        public static Bounds reproject(Envelope e,
               String from,
               String to)
        Reprojects an envelope between two coordinate reference systems.

        This method is convenience for: 

        
   reproject(e, crs(from), crs(to));

        Parameters:
        e - The envelope to reproject.
        from - The source crs, as defined by crs(String)
        to - The target crs, as defined by crs(String)
        Returns:
        The reprojected envelope.
        See Also:
        #crs(String)}, #reproject(Envelope, CoordinateReferenceSystem, CoordinateReferenceSystem)}

      • reproject

        public static Bounds reproject(Envelope e,
               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem from,
               org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem to)
        Reprojects an envelope between two coordinate reference systems.

        In the event a transformation between the two crs objects can not be found this method throws IllegalArgumentException. In the event the two specified coordinate reference systems are equal this method is a no-op and returns the original envelope.

        Parameters:
        e - The envelope to reproject.
        from - The source coordinate reference system.
        to - The target coordinate reference system.
        Returns:
        The reprojected envelope.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If no coordinate transform can be found.

      • toWKT

        public static String toWKT(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs,
           boolean format)
        Encodes a crs as Well Known Text.
        Parameters:
        crs - The coordinate reference system.
        format - Whether to format the encoded result.

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs1,
            org.osgeo.proj4j.CoordinateReferenceSystem crs2)
        Determines if two crs objects are equal.

        Two crs objects are considered equal if Datum.isEqual(Datum) returns true and the two CoordinateReferenceSystem.getProjection() instances are the same type.
